page.title: 14HARGRAVE
page.content: THE VILLAGE HALL Built in 1926 on ground purcahsed from Greene King by weekly subscription of 2d or 3d. Extensively used in the past by a variety of clubs and organisations at the moment, alas, only a popular music group use it reguarly to rehearse. It is also used for Village Hall Committee meeings, Parish Council meetings and local & general elections. The cost of recent repairs to the roof being raised from a Jumble Sale, a social evening, a disco and a donation from the annual Gymkana. Decorating being done by volunteers including rewiring and flourescent lighting. Trustees are Hargrave P.C. THE VILLAGE SHOP The shop and Post Office has survived owned by Mrs. Grenhalgh it offers a valuable service to the village, as well as, a place for a chat.
